title: Georges Seurat A Sunday on La Grande Jatte – 1884 Puzzle
description:
Georges Seurat (French, 1859–1891) A Sunday on La Grande Jatte—1884, 1884–1886 Sunday in the shadows of the park, enigmatic and still. In A Sunday on La Grande Jatte—1884, Georges Seurat captured the Parisian bourgeoisie at leisure, complete with a monkey on a leash and a fashionable woman fishing the Seine. With formal structure and a decidedly motionless quality, his influential painting stepped away from Impressionism’s fleeting imagery and broke ground for Neo-Impressionism. Enjoy the shaded riverbank as you piece together Seurat’s masterwork, pictured on this 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle.
  • Dimensions: Box size: 13 x 10 x 1.875 in, Puzzle size: 29 x 20 in.
  • Material: High-quality 250-GSM matte art paper, Ribbon-cut thick recycled paper board
  • 1000 pieces
  • Recommended for ages 12 years and up
